column1: Maggie soon thought she had been hours in the attic
column2: and it must be tea time
column3: and they were all having their tea
column4: and not thinking of her. Well
column6: she would stay up there and starve herself—hide herself behind the tub
column7: and stay there all night—and then they would all be frightened
column8: and Tom would be sorry. Thus Maggie thought in the pride of her heart
column9: as she crept behind the tub; but presently she began to cry again at the idea that they didn't mind her being there. If she went down again to Tom now—would he forgive her? Perhaps her father would be there
column10: and he would take her part. But then she wanted Tom to forgive her because he loved her
column11: not because his father told him. No
column12: she would never go down if Tom didn't come to fetch her.
